title: Top 4 Risk Management Techniques to become a way better Crypto Trader

children.text: As a crypto trader, it's vital to manage risks effectively to be successful. There are some risk management techniques that can help you become a better trader.
Diversify your portfolio:

One of the simplest and most effective risk management techniques for crypto traders is to diversify their portfolios. By investing during a spread of different cryptocurrencies, you'll minimize the impact of anybodyâ€™s particular coin on your overall portfolio.
How are you able to diversify your portfolio?

The simplest way to diversify your portfolio is to invest in a variety of asset classes, like stocks, bonds, and cash. Diversifying your portfolio is taking a foothold in a variety of different types of stocks, like large-cap stocks, small-cap stocks, and international stocks.

You can also diversify your portfolio by investing in various types of bonds, like corporate, government, and municipal bonds. Finally, you'll also diversify your portfolio by investing in a spread of different types of mutual funds, like index funds, growth funds, and value funds.
What is the dominance of diversifying your portfolio?

Diversifying your portfolio can help protect you against losses in a particular investment. Once you diversify, you spread your money across different kinds of investments, including stocks, bonds, and cash.
This strategy can facilitate you achieve your financial goals while managing risk. Diversification doesn't guarantee a profit or protect against losses.

Asset allocation could even be a key component of diversification and risk management. By spreading your assets among different asset classes, you'll help reduce the overall volatility of your portfolio.
A well-diversified portfolio can provide you with the potential to earn a much better return over the long term. Diversification can also help you manage the level of risk you are comfortable with.
2. Use stop-loss orders:

Stop-loss orders are an outstanding way to limit your downside risk in any particular trade. By placing a stop order, you'll automatically sell your position if the price of the coin falls below a certain level
2.1 How do I place a stop-loss order?

An order to sell a security when it reaches a certain price is placed with a broker. Stop-loss orders are typically placed with a broker and need the investor to state the price at which they are willing to sell the security. If the safety price falls to the stop-loss price, the order is automatically executed.
2.2 Why would you employ a stop-loss order?

An order to sell a security when it reaches a certain price is placed with a broker. This is often used to limit losses on a security position. A stop order is typically used to limit losses in security. it's an order that's placed with a broker to sell a security when it reaches a specific price. as an example, if an investor bought a stock for $50 and placed a stop order at $45, the order would be executed if the stock fell to $45, and thus the investor would sell the stock and incur a loss of $5 per share.
3. Use stop-loss orders:

Stop-loss orders are an outstanding way to limit your downside risk in any particular trade. By placing a stop order, you'll automatically sell your position if the price of the coin falls below a certain level

3.1
How do I place a stop-loss order?

An order to sell a security when it reaches a certain price is placed with a broker. Stop-loss orders are typically placed with a broker and need the investor to state the price at which they are willing to sell the security. If the safety price falls to the stop-loss price, the order is automatically executed.

3.2
Why would you employ a stop-loss order?

An order to sell a security when it reaches a certain price is placed with a broker. This is often used to limit losses on a security position. A stop order is typically used to limit losses in security. it's an order that's placed with a broker to sell a security when it reaches a specific price. as an example, if an investor bought a stock for $50 and placed a stop order at $45, the order would be executed if the stock fell to $45, and thus the investor would sell the stock and incur a loss of $5 per share.
Use limit orders:
Limit orders are another good way to protect yourself from downside risk. By placing a limit order, you'll ensure that you only sell your position if the price of the coin reaches a certain level.
4.1 How do I place a limit order?

To place a limit order, the investor submits an order to shop for or sell a security at a specified price or better. A limit order is an order to shop for or sell a security at a specified price or better. A sell limit order is filled at the required price or higher, and a buy limit order is filled at the required price or lower.

4.2
What is the dominance of using a limit order?

A limit order is an order to shop for or sell a security at a specified price or better. A buy limit order can only be executed at the limit price or below, while a sell limit order can only be executed at the limit price or above. Limit orders provide investors with greater control over the worth at which their orders are executed.
The benefits of using a limit order are that it protects against sudden price changes and provides more control over the price at which the order is executed.
5. Use trailing stops

:

Trailing stops are an outstanding tool for managing risk in your trades. By placing a trailing stop, you'll automatically sell your position if the price of the coin falls by a certain percentage.

5.1
How do I exploit a trailing stop?

To use a trailing stop, investors typically set the stop price at a specific percentage below the stock's current market price.
For example, an investor might place a trailing stop for a stock that's currently trading at $50 per share at 10% below this market price. this is often able to give the stop price a value of $45 per share. If the stock price falls to $45 per share, the order is visiting be executed and therefore the investor will sell the shares.

5.2
What are the advantages of using a trailing stop?

A trailing stop could even be a type of stop loss order that adjusts automatically as the price of an asset moves in favor of the investor. this sort of order is designed to protect profits by selling an asset automatically when its price begins to reverse. There are several benefits of employing a trailing stop. First, it can help to lock in profits because the price of an asset moves in favor of the investor. Second, it can help to attenuate losses if the price of an asset begins to reverse. Third, it can help to scale back the emotional impact of trading by removing the need to manually monitor the price of an asset.
You can become a better crypto trader and protect your portfolio from major losses by following these four risk management techniques.

title: Why do Pro Traders avoid taking more than 10x leverage in Derivatives Trading?

children.text: What is leverage and leverage ratio?

Leverage is the trade of any financial asset with capital that doesnâ€™t yet belong to the trader. This means that the purchasing or selling power of the traderâ€™s capital investment increases and it allows the investor to trade with more money than the amount actually invested.
The ratio of leverage indicates the carrying power of the initial capital invested. For example, Rs. 100 invested with a 10x leverage has a purchasing power of Rs. 1000.
Significance of Leverage

Leverage is a financing tool that allows for better capital efficiency as traders do not have to lock up entire amounts of capital in the markets. They inject liquidity into the market by allowing the investors to buy without having to invest huge sums of money initially. As the use of leverage increases potential returns, an investor can make a good chunk of return on his investment while opting for higher leverage.
The effects of opting for higher leverage

Many first-time, or even experienced traders make the mistake of over-using leverage. It then becomes a high-risk activity, where even the slightest fluctuations in the market can result in significant losses to the investor in the market.

Although there is no rule set in stone about a certain method of trading, errors on the part of the trader that can easily be avoided have to be identified. The above holds in the case of highly volatile investment avenues, such as commodities. In the case of cryptocurrencies, the very nature of the market being unpredictable can significantly increase the chances of incurring a heavy loss, sometimes even outriding the principal amount invested initially.
Here is an illustrative example of a well-leveraged portfolio:
Why leverage?

An investor lacking enough funds to invest in financial markets chooses to switch between markets. In other words, it shifts its position from the bond & stock market into the futures & options (F&O) market. The capital required to take a position in derivative markets is significantly lesser than the capital required to take a position in bond & stock markets.

It is considered wise for an investor to leverage his position as a fraction of the price required to buy on margins rather than trading directly. They hence carry greater potential for being profitable and can provide greater returns if the market performs exceedingly well.
Letâ€™s understand the same with the help of an example below to demonstrate the increased returns that future contracts provide vis-Ã -vis normal equity trades:-
The impact of transaction costs on leverage

Along with carrying a greater risk of incurring losses, leverages also run the risk of increasing the allied transaction costs. Irrespective of the marketâ€™s movement, whether positive or negative; we still have to incur transaction costs in the form of brokerage or also recurring costs while trading perpetual contracts.

There is a direct relationship between leverages and transaction costs â€“ amounting to higher risk. Furthermore, if the trade margins are considerably smaller, the expenses sometimes can appear significantly larger than the potential gains that can be made.
How do expert traders significantly manage balancing leverages?

An optimum level of leverage is recommended while trading as being conservative in derivatives trading is usually advisable, especially in the case of larger volumes. Stop orders to reduce downsize of capital and setting smaller upper limits for each position taken are advisable. The amount of leverage used depends on the trader's expertise, appetite for risk, and willingness to trade at higher volatility.

Professional traders usually have an appetite for greater risk, but it is considered wiser for them to not increase leverage beyond a certain specified limit. For example, an investor might not want to take leverage more than beyond a certain level, say 8-10 percent. For sustainable growth and achieving realistic targets, lesser amounts of leverage are preferred by expert investors who peg their leverages at around 5 percent or so.

Trading with significantly higher volumes of leverage can be increasingly dangerous for even the most experienced investor since it may also negatively affect the return on the original investment. Greater potential losses combined with higher transaction costs can harm the overall investment. Thatâ€™s why professional investors with higher trade volumes limit their leverage amount to not more than 10x of the total in derivatives.
What are the other ways in which leverage risk can be minimized?

An investor shall regularly book profits on his total investment to minimize the total risk exposure and also time his investments according to the marketâ€™s trends. Strategic analysis and a deep fundamental study of the technical aspects of the trade shall be useful in understanding the significant risks involved. Reinvestment of profits from time to time shall also help speeden the growth of the overall investment.
Initial Deposit

An initial deposit has to be made before money can be borrowed for taking leverage. The amount of leverage taken and the total number of open transactions will decide the deposit margin required. Every trader has to provide a margin for every leveraged trade apart from the first investment. More money needs to be added to the trading account if the market goes against the position held by the trader.
Conclusion â€“ The Final Word

Derivatives are an outstanding and effective financial tool to multiply oneâ€™s income, and trading using derivatives does bring amazing returns on a traderâ€™s investment. On the contrary, it is also quite risky and requires greater expertise on the part of the trader. Combine it with cryptocurrencies, and trading crypto could get all the riskier.

A trader may initially begin by investing less money and test the waters for greater returns by the use of leverage. However, using significant leverage might quickly result in liquidation due to the inverse relationship between leverage and market volatility. Lower leverage applied to trades gives more leeway by allowing the trader to set broader but diligent pit-stops and avoid running a higher principal loss in the event of a downfall.

It may be noted that every trader's needs can be addressed by changing the leverage percentage at any given point in time. One needs to take due care when trading and consider individual risk tolerance before using leverage. The bottom line is - never use leverage when trading with money you cannot afford to lose.

title: The Market Will Test You - Take Custody Of Your Crypto Assets

children.text: Crypto industry horror stories abound about lost passwords, hacks, and stolen funds. Crypto custody plays an important role here.
Custodians, who have existed since the 1960s, are a pillar of traditional banking.

There is a difference between crypto custody and traditional custody. Because the blockchain contains all data and transactions, digital asset custodians are not technically required to store digital assets.
Crypto custody explained:
The purpose of crypto custody is to secure funds or holdings of crypto wallets off-chain in order to prevent theft or loss.
Institutional investors, hedge funds, and governments are well known for using cryptocurrency custody services.
When crypto custodians combine hot, warm, and cold wallets, they provide the highest level of security. Keys containing complex alphanumerics act as passwords.
Importance of Crypto Custody:

The role of crypto custody solutions in protecting high-net-worth individuals' crypto assets cannot be overstated. Cryptocurrency holdings are protected against cyberattacks, hackers, human error, and internal collusion through institutional-grade custody systems. Those custody software solutions often take advantage of multi-party computation (MPC) to eliminate a single point of failure. How? Simple. They use distributed bank vaults to recover from disasters.
Although there's more to crypto custody than just storage.
Institutions and enterprises can enter the crypto market when assets are shown under custody with regulated custodians.
Operations get interrupted due to these technical challenges and are expensive to tackle.
Categories of Crypto Custody:
It is important to prove the ownership of the wallet. It is equally important to keep the private keys secure and they arrive in these 3 types.
Self Custody:

This crypto custody option is perfect if you want complete control of crypto assets via personal private keys. Self-custodians use software across devices or hardware wallets for better security. The downside is that you canâ€™t seek help from a third-party intermediary if you lose the physical device or forget the private keys. It is advisable to protect yourself by updating software, upgrading backup capabilities, and finding ways to recover funds in emergency situations.
Third Party Custody:
Third-party custody services store and maintain digital assets on behalf of customers. Third-party custodians use custom features and controls to manage assets.

They offer institutional-grade security, insurance and standardisation rules. These features make third-party custody suitable for institutions and investors from hedge funds, high net worth individuals (HNWIs), and asset managers.
Third-party custodians are registered, regulated financial institutions with licences on the state or national level. Their
service level agreements (SLAs)
with customers determine crypto fund storage and access.
Partial Custody:

HNWIs who do not opt for full third-party crypto management often decide on split or partial custody. These custody solutions offer institutional protections while letting investors have control over holdings.
Partial custody systems work by security protocols such as
two-factor authentication (2FA)
or multisignature protections (MSP) to hardware wallets. For instance, a partial custody solution may require a third party to co-sign along with the investor for transaction authorization.

This cooperation between both parties is at the core of partial custody. They can create a legal arrangement to decide the amount of control. In case of emergency, these arrangements help investors move funds without third-party keys. Investors must understand the solution providerâ€™s software upgrade, recovery, backup, and transaction identity verification policies before signing an agreement, to protect their interest.
Crypto custodians uses different technologies and the reasons why they choose them.
Cold Wallets:

A cold wallet or hardware wallet holds cryptographic keys securely in a physical device or hardware security module (HSM). HSMs generate and hold private keys securely. They can also approve and sign transactions.

One canâ€™t steal funds without accessing the wallet device. This immunity to hacking comes at the expense of access speed. Due to the access speed, which may take up to 48 hours to transfer funds, the cold wallet is immune to hacking. Cold wallets arenâ€™t ideal for frequent asset trading.
Warm Wallets:

These wallets keep private keys online for ease of transaction. Hot wallets bank on internet connectivity to store, receive, and send digital tokens. It creates and records blockchain transactions without human intervention.

Hot wallets are easy to use but are more exposed to theft because they store private keys online. Any security breach may lead to your losing the keys. Therefore, itâ€™s best not to keep large amounts of crypto in hot wallets.
Crypto custodies generally use a combination of cold and hot wallets.

The warm wallet is a digital asset storage system that uses downloadable software to keep funds secure. With warm wallets, you get the speed of hot wallets and the security of cold wallets. These wallets can still automate transactions, but you must sign them. As a result of this human involvement, warm wallets are safer than hot wallets.
Multi-party computation (MPC):

This is a form of advanced cryptography. By allowing multiple parties to hold different parts of a key, private keys are kept secure. With MPC, private keys are broken down into encrypted shares, and no one knows who holds the other part of the key. A transaction, however, requires the signature of all parties.

MPC allows you to recover assets and remove single points of failure from self-custody. Crypto custody solutions powered by MPC are popular among global asset managers seeking cross-chain trading and liquidity.
Multi-signature or multi-sig approvals (MSA):
In order to digitally sign and approve transactions, it uses multi-party authorization. MSA algorithms allow you to authorise transactions for all authorised addresses or a subset.
Often, hot wallets require multi-signature approvals for signatures. MSA prevents a single person from compromising the assets of a hot wallet.
Key Takeaways - Call To Action:
Crypto custody uses cryptographic keys to secure crypto funds.
To start using crypto custody, you need to:
Choose a crypto custody solution provider.
Perform Know Your Customer (KYC) and anti-money laundering (AML) checks.
Move your digital asset holdings to crypto custodians.
There are two types of keys: public and private.
The public key contains an alphanumeric code that can be used by other parties to make deposits.
The private key gives you access to wallet funds through encrypted code.

Strings of characters make up cryptographic keys. Data is encrypted so that your key appears random. If you don't have the right key, you can't decrypt it. It's for this reason that key management is so important when it comes to securing crypto funds.

https://www.coindesk.com/learn/what-is-crypto-custody/

https://www.g2.com/articles/crypto-custody

author: Team Density

title: What is Reduce Only Order ?

children.text: Introduction:

Trading with reduce-only orders enables traders to execute buy and sell orders that reduce current positions instead of opening opposite long or short positions larger than the asset's value, preventing over-exposure of positions.

In the event that an order marked as "reduce-only" results in an increase in position size, the order will be cancelled. It is most useful when combined with stop orders, although the reduce-only flag can be used with any order type.
Highlights include:
1. With Reduce Only Orders, only the user's position is reduced. This option should not be selected when you wish to open a position or increase your position, as it will result in an order failure.
2. If the contract size of the open position is less than or equal to the contract size of the reduce-only order, the order will be automatically reduced or cancelled.
3. Within the Position tab, there is a function called "close by limit/market price" that incorporates the Reduce-only option.
4. PC clients are permitted to use the function.
These advantages include:

Typically, a Reduce Only Order is used in situations where users wish to avoid being identified as holding open positions for orders they have placed. A Reduce Only Order entails adding an additional function to a user's position, so that it may only be closed and will not be accidentally increased.
Example 1:

The current price of your Buy Long 10 BTCUSD contract is 10,000 USDT, and your stop loss order is set at 8,000 USDT. A take profit order with a limit price of 15,000 USDT is placed in order to sell the contract. Below are two examples of setting a Take Profit with and without selecting the Reduce-only option:
â€» Without Reduce-only Option
You would profit by selling your long contracts of 10 BTCUSD if the BTC price rose to 15,000 USDT as expected.

A stop-loss order will likely be fulfilled if the Last Traded BTC Price plunges first to 8,000 USDT, then rises to 15,000 USDT to trigger the take profit limit order. Users will likely open an unintended position for 10 BTCUSD short contracts at USD 15,000 USDT when the previous take profit limit order is fulfilled.
â€» With Reduce-only Option

However, despite the fact that the Last Traded BTC Price triggers the order's stop-loss first to sell the long contract of 10 BTCUSD, the corresponding take profit limit order at 15,000 USDT will automatically be cancelled because of the reduce only option, thereby ensuring that it is not executed in order to prevent future unintended openings of short positions for 10 BTCUSD contracts.
Examples 2:
Let's say you have 5 ETH-USD LONG positions open.
You will receive an error if you attempt to place a Reduce-Only order to SELL 6 ETH.
A Reduce-Only order for BUY any size will result in an error and you will not be able to complete the order.

You will be able to place this order with a valid trigger price if you place a Reduce-Only Stop Market SELL at 6 ETH. Your order will automatically be resized from 6 ETH to 5 ETH when it triggers. As a result, the remaining SELL 5 ETH order will be executed to complete the closing of your LONG position.

author: Team Density

title: What is Maker & Taker Fees

children.text: In the fast-paced world of cryptocurrency futures trading, understanding the dynamics of maker and taker fees is crucial for success. These fees play a pivotal role in shaping the landscape for traders, influencing their strategies and ultimately impacting their bottom line.

Let's break down the basics: Maker and taker fees are transaction costs associated with buying or selling contracts on a futures exchange. Each fee serves a distinct purpose, creating a delicate balance in the crypto trading ecosystem.
Maker Fees:
Makers
are traders who provide liquidity to the market by placing
limit orders

that do not immediately fill. In other words, they're the architects of the market, crafting opportunities for others to seize. As a reward for contributing to the order book, makers often enjoy lower transaction costs, known as maker fees. These fees incentivize traders to bring liquidity to the market, fostering a healthy and vibrant trading environment.
Taker Fees:
On the flip side,
takers
are the traders who are ready to pounce on existing
market orders,

consuming liquidity from the order book. Taker fees are slightly higher compared to maker fees, reflecting the cost of executing trades that immediately match with existing orders. Takers pay this premium for the convenience of instant execution, grabbing opportunities as they arise.

title: Understanding the Order Book: A Key Resource for Traders

children.text: Just like how a driver needs a dashboard to monitor the speed, fuel level, and other important information about the car, a trader needs an order book to monitor the
demand and supply
dynamics of the market. The order book on
Density
is like a
digital dashboard for traders

, providing them with real-time and transparent information about the current and historical orders to buy or sell an asset. It is a valuable tool that allows traders to make informed decisions about their trading strategies and react quickly to changes in the market.
Orderbook of Density platform
Benefits of Using the Order Book
Firstly, Order books are used by traders to view the current and recent market activity and the
liquidity
of various markets. They are an important resource for traders who need to understand the market dynamics to make informed trading decisions.

author: Team Density

title: Best Crypto Trading Strategies for Beginners

children.text: The popularity of cryptocurrency has skyrocketed in the past few years. Cryptocurrency trading refers to the procedure of purchasing and selling crypto through blockchain exchanges that works digitally. Owing to the decentralised approach of crypto trading while they are not influenced by economic concerns, various external factors like demand and supply make them fairly risky.
Being a beginner in crypto trading, you should be aware of the crypto trading strategies to ensure earning more returns down the line. To know more about some proven strategies, keep reading.
6 Best Crypto Trading Strategies for Beginners

Owing to the unpredictable and volatile nature of cryptocurrencies, it makes sense to pursue unique strategies before getting involved in the trade. In fact, crypto trading refers to an activity of predicting the movement of crypto prices through a CFD or â€˜Contract for Difference Tradingâ€™.

While involving in such predictive trading can help you gain lucrative profit without having to possess much capital, it could be equally risky for your financial life. Mentioned below are the basic strategies in crypto trading for beginners:
Day Trading

The approach of crypto day trading involves entering into and withdrawing from a position in the market on a specific day before the crypto trading hours. This strategy is also called intraday trading since trades are generally carried out within one day. Therefore, you can execute day trading with Bitcoin volatility all day.

The main objective of day trading cryptocurrency is to generate profit from small but important market movements. Since crypto is volatile, there remains a chance of risk, which can cause further trouble in the future. However, following day trading strategy in the cryptocurrency market can be substantially rewarding. The approach is formulated by skilled day traders through their technical analysis. However, this approach is much more time-consuming.
Swing Trading

Swing trading strategy is intended for relatively longer-term trading that suggests holding currencies for more than a day, not beyond a certain week or a month. One notable point of swing trading that makes it a dynamic trading strategy for newbies is that swing trades take a minimal waiting time to keep close track of the wave of volatility.

While playing, you must not wait for more than a specific time that makes it challenging to trail the trade. Swing traders adopt a mix of technical and basic influencing factors in order to formulate such trade ideas. This is why analysing chart patterns is important to be a gainer in this trading.
Crypto Futures Trading

Another well-known crypto trading strategy for beginners is the crypto futures trading approach. This strategy requires formulating a contract between two different parties who agree to purchase and sell a predetermined amount of any underlying crypto such as Bitcoin a definite future price on a pre-specified time and date.

Futures trading strategies come with an extensive range of cryptocurrencies. However, it does not require you to hold any of them. For instance, people holding crypto may utilise a futures trading approach in order to safeguard themselves from unforeseen and unavoidable market fluctuations.
Dollar Cost Averaging (DCA)

Dollar-cost averaging (DCA) is a time-tested and proven strategy that works effectively due to its scientific concept of trading. DCA trading approach suggests you to invest your money in specific cryptocurrency in smaller amounts by dividing it, rather than investing at a single time. In this method, you need to select a specific day and time of the week and buy crypto at that specific time only.

For example, you want to invest Rs. 20000 in Bitcoin. Accordingly, despite investing the whole amount at a time, follow the DCA strategy and make sure to divide your money by 20 times, which comes to Rs. 500. Now, choose a specific day and time of the week for buying Bitcoin. Say, you have chosen Friday at 10 AM as per your local time. Now, continue buying your desired cryptocurrency every Friday at the same time for 20 weeks.

Investing in fixed intervals over a longer span will enhance the likelihood to lessen the impact of the volatility of the market. On average this will return you more bitcoins in your wallet than if you had invested your money at a single time.
Arbitrage Trading

Many traders depend on arbitrage options in order to gain more profits via cryptocurrency. In economics, arbitrage is the strategy of purchasing and selling commodities, securities, and currency across various markets to enjoy variant pricing for the same asset. Traders can reserve profit derived from the differences in liquidity. They register on exchanges with the price differences for the cryptocurrency they are trading to grab the benefit of this strategy.
Scalp Trading

Another great crypto trade strategy is scalp trading. In this trading approach, traders typically aim at making a small margin of profits by involving in several deals over a short-term period. This consequently enables them to earn substantial revenue generated through multiple small gains.
However, this strategy requires a good degree of awareness of the crypto market. You can gain this knowledge by conducting market research and studying the prevalent trends.
How Beginners Trade in Cryptocurrency?
Mentioned below is a step-by-step procedure that may help a novice crypto trader to commence their journey in the world of crypto trading:
Step 1
: Thoroughly check the reviews online and choose your desired platform for crypto trading.
Step 2

: After a successful registration, you can gather the necessary assets in your wallet. If required, you can refer to the respective platform's suggestions in order to get an idea regarding the best cryptocurrencies.
Step 3

: According to the nature of trading, choose your preferred option or the one that suits you the best. Being a beginner, you should adhere to some medium or long-term investments owing to their lower risk and easy accessibility.
Step 4
: Take expert assistance and go through the in-app technical indicators and expert analysis sections in order to conduct your research.
Step 5
: Purchase units of crypto and keep them for a pre-determined period in your wallet till you find the perfect opportunity to sell them for earning profit.
Upon completion of these steps, you will be eligible to trade in cryptocurrency.
What Are Some Noteworthy Cryptocurrencies Available?
Mentioned below are some important cryptocurrencies available:
Bitcoin
Ether
Litecoin
EOS
Ether/Bitcoin
Stellar
Bitcoin Cash
Chainlink
Dogecoin
Polkadot
Cardano
Uniswap
Takeaway

So, from the above discussion, being a potential investor and beginner in cryptocurrency trade, you can leverage strategic trading to earn more coins. The cryptocurrency market is promising but risky as well. Therefore, before entering into the trade, make sure to gain good knowledge about this market considering its benefits and risk factors.

author: Team Density

title: Cryptocurrency Payments and Payment Gateways: A Detailed Overview

children.text: Cryptocurrency has totally revolutionised and disrupted traditional financial set up. Apart from investment and trading, you can also use crypto coins for making payments. As digital currency is gaining more popularity and adoption, it is being increasingly accepted by businesses globally.
According to a report by
Deloitte

, 75% of global businesses are set to accept crypto coins as payments within a couple of years. While making payments via cryptos, you can either opt for the manual transaction method or use any of the payment gateways.
If you are new to the world of digital currencies and interested to know more about this newest way of payment, check out the sections below.
Crypto Payments: A Basic Rundown

Crypto payment is basically transferring funds in the form of digital coins or cryptocurrencies from your wallet to another. As mentioned, you can do it manually with the help of the public address of the recipient.

Payments made via digital currencies are a faster, cheaper and safer way of transacting funds. You do not need to use fiat currencies and the fund transfers are protected with cryptography technology.
So, now you can pay back a friend or buy an item using digital currency with the help of a payment method that is based on blockchain technology.
To carry out fund transfer, you will require the following things:
A Crypto Wallet

This is a virtual wallet to store all your digital currencies. You can opt for any kind of crypto wallet depending on your preference. Each type of crypto wallet comes with specific features and benefits.
Your Private Key

The private key is your password to access the crypto wallet. You cannot initiate any transaction without this. Do make sure to keep it safe and secure as anybody with the knowledge of your private keys can use your cryptos from the wallet.
Crypto Payment Gateways: What Is it and How Does it Work?

Manual crypto payment transfer requires you to use the public address of the one who would receive the funds. You have to copy the address to send funds. But it is usually not as simple as it might sound. One can end up sending cryptos to wrong address or choose an incorrect blockchain network. Such mistakes can lead to a loss of funds that can be irreversible.

On the other hand, to make the transaction process smooth, many crypto payment gateways have come up. These payment processors help to manage your wallet and conduct the transaction between customers and merchants in an error-free and efficient way.
There are many crypto payment gateways and the way they work might differ. But these are the basic steps in which a crypto transaction takes place via such gateways:
Letâ€™s say you as a customer have decided to pay for a service or a purchased good.

The merchant, who would be the recipient of the payment, will set up a digital invoice on a payment gateway. The invoice is generally a QR code that will have the merchantâ€™s crypto wallet address along with the amount required to be paid.
You will then have to scan that QR code and then confirm the payment.
The digital coin will be transferred from your wallet to the merchantâ€™s digital wallet or account.
All this takes place within a few minutes and the process is totally hassle-free, convenient and faster as compared to manual payment process.
Payment with Crypto Cards

Now, you can also use crypto cards to make payments! Yes, thatâ€™s right. These cards are just like your traditional debit and credit cards, albeit they are virtual cards and are linked to your crypto wallet.

For using a crypto card, you will have to first link it with your crypto wallet. You can use it to pay for any goods or services and the required amount will be removed from your wallet, transferred to local currency and deposited to the merchantâ€™s account or wallet in their preferred currency or coin.
Crypto Payment: Benefits and Drawbacks
Compared to traditional currency, payments with cryptocurrency come with various advantages. Some of these are as follows:
Crypto payments are global. You can easily use digital coins to send or receive payments from any part of the world.

One of the most significant features of cryptocurrencies is that they are totally decentralised. In other words, your payments are free from the control or influence of governments or central banking authorities.
These payments are fast and secure. The transactions are verified by nodes and then registered on blockchains. This makes the transactions totally irreversible and safe.
Also, crypto payment transactions are entirely anonymous.
Despite these advantages, there are some major drawbacks of crypto payments. These are:
Crypto payment is relatively new and there is still much gap in understanding how it works. This can lead to payment-related issues, confusion and misunderstanding.
Since digital currencies are not under the supervision of any governing body, there is little protection both for customers and businesses in case of any discrepancy or errors.

As cryptocurrencies are speculative in nature, their values can face regular fluctuations. This could mean that prices of any goods or services that you buy with digital currencies can change rapidly.
If you are using a payment gateway, you have to pay an additional charge as processing fee.
Takeaway

Over the years, the global financial system has significantly evolved. Payment via cryptocurrencies is the latest addition to the long list of payment methods that you can use today. There are various ways in which you can use cryptos for fund transfers or for paying for products and services. Crypto payments are fast, hassle-free, secure and smooth.
With more and more businesses accepting digital currencies as payment options, crypto payment will only become more popular in the coming years.

title: How Does Crypto Trading Work?

children.text: The cryptocurrency market has been in the news more frequently than ever in the last couple of years. Customers' interest has skyrocketed owing to the gradual escalation of Bitcoin's price over the past decade.

However, many quickly lose hope from crypto trading failing to generate estimated returns. The fault is neither of an exchange platform nor the investors who highly talk about cryptocurrencies. You must know the proper timing for buying and selling your crypto holdings. Read along to learn how crypto trading works.
How does Crypto Trading Work?

You can start investing in cryptocurrencies in one of two methods. In the first procedure, you register a new account by visiting the online portal or opening the application of a crypto exchange platform. Then you are all set to buy and sell the various cryptocurrencies which get stored in your wallet.
Investments via an exchange allow you to speculate the live market value of each cryptocurrency. It helps you can determine the right time to sell your holdings and garner profit out of a deal.

The second most popular way of crypto trading is via CFDs (Contracts of Difference). More experienced investors generally prefer this method as it comes with multiple advantages. Unlike the first system, you do not own the underlying assets in CFDs. Instead, you enter into a contract with another investor. Both of you agree to exchange the margin to be generated between the opening and closing of a mutually fixed time.
What are the Various Types of Crypto Trading?
Crypto trading can be broadly classified into three categories such as:
Swing Trading

Swing traders focus on capturing gains over a short or mid-term investment. They tend to stay invested in the underlying assets for somewhere between a few days to some weeks. Swing trading calls for a fundamental analysis of the overall market scenario besides grasping the current trends and pricing patterns.
Merits
Provides more time to anticipate the pricing patterns compared to intraday trading
Risk is comparatively less as traders stress on grasping the knowledge of technical indicators rather than depending on overnight market shifts
Demands less active involvement than regular day trading
Causes less stress for the traders and is somewhat beginner-friendly
Demerits
Calls for more practical expertise and in-depth research
May trigger emotional reactions from the traders as they manage their holdings and see growth over time
Demands long-term discipline to ensure flawless implementation of a strategy
Day Trading

Day trading specifically involves crypto traders who buy and sell currency units within the same trading window. Their motive revolves around bagging profits from the sharp fluctuations of prices that they predict by assuming market inefficiencies. Popularly, this form of trading is also referred to as â€˜intraday tradingâ€™.
Merits
Guarantees profits very quickly
Develops desirable qualities of a trader like precise risk-controlling ability and emotional stability despite frequent market shifts
Demerits
Triggers obsessive behaviour especially when you occasionally procure short-term profits
Involves greater risk owing to the highly volatile nature of crypto assets
Generates more pressure on the trader as mistiming a transaction can lead to a substantial loss of money
Not suitable for newcomers who often depend on short-term trends to ensure gains
Position Trading

Popularly referred to as â€˜trend tradingâ€™, here you buy definite units and retain them for longer periods before finally selling them off. To become successful following this concept you have to learn to ignore short-term price movements and plan for several upcoming months. Hence, you should have adequate experience, strong analytical skills, and a disciplined research regimen to perform position trading.
Merits

Demerits

How Can Beginners Trade in Cryptocurrency?

Step 4

Step 5

Takeaway

Due to its extreme volatility, trading in cryptocurrencies carries a risk of losing your invested money. Hence, before investing, you should be aware that not all investors would be a good fit for cryptocurrencies. title: What is Crypto Fear and Greed Index?

children.text: The pricing of cryptocurrencies gets influenced due to all crypto investorsâ€™ persistent sentiments. These sentiments arise based on factors that are directly related to established crypto investment strategies.

Contextually the crypto fear and greed index acts as an indicator helping retail investors and businesses to predict market behaviours. This saves considerable time otherwise spent on performing detailed market analysis. Typically, this reading varies from 0 to 100 where the lowest status points to severe fear while higher scores refer to acute greed. Here, you will know about this in detail.
What is the Meaning of Crypto Fear and Greed Index?

It is a metric that is published based on various crypto market trends and overall response of the prominent digital currency holders. The main reason for considering this reading to be an index is that it produces a cumulative reflection of data collected from multiple trustworthy sources.
The crypto fear and greed index is composed of four alert zones that are represented by different colours:
Extreme fear or orange zone (Marking remains between 0 â€“ 24)
Fear or light yellow or yellow zone (Marking remains between 25 â€“ 49)
Greed or green zone (Marking remains between 50 â€“ 74)
Extreme greed or deep green zone (Marking remains between 75 â€“ 100)

As per the conventional trading mindset, when this fear and greed index is close to 1 it demonstrates an excellent buying opportunity. This is because when reading hovers across the orange zone, most of the investors fear a sharp dip. You can use this situation to your advantage and increase your crypto holdings to balance your portfolio. Implementing this strategy may benefit you in the long run as the prices remain deflated at this time.
How is the Crypto Fear and Greed Index Calculated?

Various platforms recording data of internet users globally, crunch the investorsâ€™ sentiments to manifest an easy-to-relate figure. While doing so they consider several determiners that have been listed below:
Dominance

One of the major factors determining this index is Bitcoinâ€™s craze among the overall pool of crypto traders. Generally, when the popularity of Bitcoin goes up it indicates that the investors are more fearful. Approximately 10% of the fear and greed index depends on this dominance component.
Surveys

Market-wide surveys take place every week where crypto investors post their opinions voluntarily. These enquiry forms note down responses of a significant number of active traders (usually varying between 2000 and 3000). The fear and greed index soars if the survey results reveal high enthusiasm toward buying assets.
Volatility

The volatility factor takes into consideration all major drawdowns. A drawdown refers to the diminution of top-ranking cryptocurrencies over the previous 30 days to 90 days. If the final output of this component becomes high it positively impacts the index. Volatility plays the biggest role in determining the fear and greed index resulting in almost 25% of the ultimate reading.
Social Media

The index partially relies on consumer behaviour across leading social media platforms. Usually, discussions take place involving specific hashtags and mentions that directly correlate to the crypto world. Analysts track these records and attempt to draw precise comparisons against a similar previous array of datasets. A greater volume of mentions and hashtags indicates an agile market and eventually higher index.
Google Trends

Google trend numbers play a notable role in deciding the fear and greed index. At least 10% of the index relies on this part where greater traffic involving the appropriate phrases shows substantial greed in the global crypto market.
Momentum

This conclusive factor evaluates the current market trends against the most recent daily averages (typically records from the past 3 months). If this metric is high, it corresponds to more greed. For this reason, you must consider momentum to be a negative indicator that prominently influences the index, almost by 25%.
How Can You Use the Fear and Greed Index to your Advantage?
As you presumably know, the cryptocurrency market may occasionally be unpredictable. This happens mainly because of investors' emotional responses to the market.

When the market is rising, typically the mass experiences desperate urges and become avaricious. Similarly, when the market takes a dip, they may likewise panic and sell their holdings. To reduce the chances of getting caught in these traps, many traders use the index as a market indicator, so they may trade more intelligently.
All platforms churning out the index advise you to continue successful crypto trading backed by these guidelines:
Global cryptocurrency investors' excessive fear may present a favourable purchasing opportunity in times of extreme panic.
On the other hand, extreme greed may indicate that investors are acting aggressively and that a market downturn is shortly pending.
Can You Rely on Crypto Fear and Greed Index for Long-Term Trading?

Generally, this index does not always hold true in cases of long-drawn bull runs. Instead, it responds to breaking news and momentary fluctuations in the cryptocurrency market. These factors make it more popular among traders as a short-term indication than a long-term one. As one may anticipate, intraday and swing traders particularly prefer this index.
Takeaway

It is hard to precisely anticipate how cryptocurrency values will move in the future. However, prominent metrics, such as the fear and greed index, provide meaningful information. That is why prospective investors and crypto enthusiasts need to comprehend the correct use of this index.

title: Understanding Cosmos - The Internet of Blockchains

children.text: The Cosmos blockchain was established in order to enable communication between various ledgers without depending on a centralised server. This Internet of blockchains is aimed at forming a communicative platform of open-source blockchains which can ease the implementation of transactions between them. Cosmos has been introduced to streamline this issue which made individuals more enthusiastic to know about it. To get a deeper insight about the topic of Cosmos, keep reading.
What Do You Mean by Cosmos?

Considered as the â€˜Internet of blockchainsâ€™, Cosmos (ATOM) refers to a decentralised ecosystem of independent blockchains. All of them have been power-driven by the Byzantine Fault-Tolerant (BFT) consensus algorithms.

The key reason which is responsible for the advancement of Cosmos blockchain is its usage by different cryptographs, wherein they perform independently. However, in case of Cosmos, it is the blockchain internet in which every blockchain performs together.

The main ambition of Cosmos aims is to connect various blockchain-based programs in order to form a network in which they can operate together. Even though blockchains are independent, they can communicate with other blockchains, and the user can easily exchange coins via Cosmos on various blockchain networks.
What Are the Benefits of Cosmos Crypto?
Since the world of cryptocurrency is highly volatile, it has several advantages and disadvantages. Mentioned below are the noteworthy advantages of Cosmos crypto:
Cosmos demonstrates that the association between various blockchains does not interrupt their privacy.
Cosmos crypto can overcome the problems related to scalability that were a crucial factor in the world of crypto.
A plethora of other projects take the help of Cosmos crypto. This is mainly due to its dynamic and powerful operation.
What Are the Demerits of Cosmos Crypto?
Following are the major disadvantages of cosmos crypto:

Cosmos experiences certain problems from the perspective of technology. For example, several blockchains do not work together in the collection of networks. Consequently, it keeps the future of this project remain unpredictable.
Cosmos operate beside stronger competitors, like AION, Panta, and Polkadot. Hence, in order to draw the interest of people this network requires progressing faster.
How Does Cosmos Crypto Network Work?

The Cosmos crypto network performs through various blocks. These blocks work in conjunction in order to achieve the required function. Mentioned below are those noteworthy blocks through which this network is performing:
Networking Functionality

Any process establishing communication between different platforms on a Cosmos network is known as its networking functionality. Cosmos crypto facilitates the insertion of various functions across different sources. This is considered among the primary features of a Cosmos Hub.
PoS (Proof-of-Stake) Consensus Mechanism

Cosmos uses the PoS system in order to authenticate various transactions on the network. This mechanism enables the traders of crypto to stake some of their tokens for earning passive income. However, this mechanism can only function provided the coin belongs to a specific blockchain.
Housed Applications

Housed applications refer to those platforms which are used on a Cosmos network. These applications enable the carry out of transactions on a network which helps the users stay updated on their progress alongside following the PoS consensus mechanism. Every node on a Cosmos network is called as zones which is maintained by the Cosmos crypto.
Which Layers Are Found in a Cosmos Blockchain?
The Cosmos blockchain comes with three distinctive layers that are arranged together through open-source tools. This enables you to create blockchain applications. These layers include:
Application layer:
It keeps tracking and protecting transactions alongside updating the state of the network.
Networking layer:
It enables communication across various blockchains.
Consensus layer:
This node on this layer agrees on the current system state.
How to Invest in Cosmos Cryptocurrency?

The Cosmos (ATOM) cryptocurrency price has been ranging between $8 and $15 per coin for the past two years. When this form of crypto was launched, it was considered by market capitalisation among the 38th largest crypto. From that time onwards, the cost of the coin has risen beyond 110%.The trading of this token is executed across various popular exchanges, like Crypto.com, Kucoin, Coinbase, and more. An individual can easily invest in Cosmos (ATOM) crypto by following the steps mentioned below:
Step 1: Generate an Account
You will require opening an account on your desired crypto exchange in order to purchase ATOM tokens. However, keep in mind that the platform chosen by a person facilitates trading for ATOM.
Step 2: Make Deposits

After forming your account successfully, you will need to deposit a lump sum amount of funds, in the form of Dollars, Stablecoin, or Bitcoin. This is determined by the trading pairs which enable exchange.
Step 3: Start Trading

Choose a trading pair which comprises an ATOM coin and a currency. For instance, if you are having Bitcoin and desire to purchase ATOM, it is better to choose â€œBTC/ATOMâ€. Subsequently, select the number of coins you desire to buy. On the other hand, you may use a decentralised exchange in order to purchase ATOM coins.
Step 4: Store Your Coin
Once you purchase the coin, you may move your crypto to your personal crypto wallet from the exchange in order to get more security over your assets.
Which Tools Help in the Functioning of Cosmos?
Mentioned below are three vital tools that help in the proper functioning of a Cosmos network:
Cosmos Software Development Kit (SDK)
Inter Blockchain Communication (IBC) Protocol
Tendermint Byzantine Fault Tolerance (BFT) Engine
Takeaway

Cosmos has turned out to be a highly effective cryptocurrency as they are connecting blockchains. It considerably facilitates each crypto to perform well during their operation. Consequently, when they partner with others, they carry out their performance much better. Furthermore, the total strength of a blockchain industry will enhance considerably as Cosmos is likely to establish a promising future for digital currency.

title: Differences Between Bullish & Bearish Crypto Market

children.text: The terms â€˜bullâ€™ and â€˜bearâ€™ generally appear while discussing stock market proceedings. Market analysts tag a rising market to be bullish where the investors portray high confidence and there remains a stable volume of stock purchases.
On the other hand, bearish markets refer to periods where the value of assets takes a dip and the movement stays persistent for some time.
In this article, you will understand how these trends apply to the crypto world. Finally, you will get to know about their major differences.
What Is Bull Market?

A bull market signifies a market trend when most investors feel comfortable in allocating their funds to newer assets. In a nutshell, it indicates that the market is on the rise. Investor sentiments regarding the contemporary parameters seem positive during such periods.

When cryptocurrency markets are said to be undergoing a bull run you will see a stable rise in the prices of different crypto tokens. Indirectly, these conditions speak highly about an economy and indicate comparatively steady employment status.
What Are the Key Reasons Leading to a Bullish Market?

Crypto investors as a whole community are responsible for the initiation of â€˜bull phasesâ€™. Led by various current affairs or sometimes even getting convinced by any prominent investor, they start buying coins with a fresh dream of gaining high ROI later on.

In addition, many other factors may also cause the beginning of a bull run. These reasons can be a remarkably low unemployment rate, predictable GDP growth, etc. As the cryptocurrency segment is comparatively new, the bullish market may be influenced by some of its unique factors as well. For example, these are some of the instances that previously caused a boom in the global crypto market are:

On January 2021 the financial strategists at JP Morgan Chase & Co. announced via their reports that Bitcoin has the potential to rally up to $146,000 over time. Also, they hold this currency as an alternative to gold.

Recently, following the dreadful effects of the COVID-19 pandemic, traditional assets took a tough hit in terms of valuation. It caused many people to rely on crypto assets more than ever for growing their net worth in the long run.
What Are Some Characteristics of a Bull Market?
These are a few typical signs that you will witness in a bull market:
Cryptocurrencies are traded at a hiked price for a sustained period.
Graphical representations portraying buying trends continue going up for long.
Crypto assets, NFTs, and other resources that need digital tokens for access remain overpriced.
News and other media platforms are frequently talking about the increased rates.
If a negative incident takes place, the price drops only a little bit.
What Is Bear Market?

Bear market initiates when the values of prominent crypto tokens fall by at least 20% and the negative graph continues to extend. The most infamous price crash was noticed back in December 2017 when investors had to witness a drastic fall in Bitcoin pricing. Within a week Bitcoinâ€™s valuation came down to a mere $3,200 from a massive amount of $20,000.

As the abrupt market movement creates a shock, the investorsâ€™ sentiments further follow a downward mindset. Bear markets are known for creating a pessimistic atmosphere which often leads to panic selling of actual holdings. However, you need to understand is that these runs ultimately end and are followed by yet another prolonged bull phase. Thus buying during the bearish market can eventually lead to profits when the market begins to revive.
What Are the Key Reasons Leading to a Bearish Market?
As already mentioned, a bear market normally starts when prices start to decline. Further downward trends occur from investors losing hope that prices will rise.
While a bear market can have a variety of causes, there are a few signs that set prior indications that one is about to begin. These include:
Persistent records of lower trading volume act as a firm indication. It specifically emphasises that people have begun to hang onto their possessions fearing the marketâ€™s instability.

Another common reason that causes a bearish trend is backwardation. When the projections in the futures market portray the price of an asset to decline below its current price, investors consider that to be a red flag.

Finally, the involvement of regulatory bodies also plays a significant role. During many instances, mining operations and crypto trading are forced to shut down as a result of statutory regulations, which increase uncertainty among investors.
What Are Some Characteristics of a Bear Market?
Few of the common attributes that go hand in hand with a bearish market are as follows:
Supply of crypto assets exceeds the projected demand.
Crypto tokens are traded over the exchanged platforms at a deflated price.
Hype regarding crypto trading becomes almost nil across all media platforms.
Economists and financial advisors do not speak in favour of escalating crypto possessions.
What Are the Differences Between a Bull and Bear Market?
You can see the main distinguishing aspects in the table below:
Takeaway

Multiple factors trigger the initiation of bull and bear crypto markets. Investors dealing with cryptocurrencies generally buy during bear markets and stick to their holdings. It eventually allows them to garner benefits when the next bull market starts. Besides this, several advanced tactics are deployed by veteran traders to capitalise on varied circumstances.

So, if you are new to the world of cryptocurrency you might feel a bit overwhelmed by the sheer number of options that you get. However, not all coins are worth your money. If you want to make the best of your crypto investment, then these are some of the top cryptocurrencies of 2023.
Top Cryptocurrencies to Invest in 2023

The value of a stablecoin stays same as that of the real-life currency it is pegged to and these are comparatively less volatile than other cryptos.

Cardano

Polygon

Dogecoin
Thanks to Elon Muskâ€™s direct endorsement, Dogecoin, which began simply as a joke, skyrocketed in 2021. This unusual jump helped to generate massive gains for the investors.

Elon Musk had been constantly promoting this meme coin on Twitter and this led to the jump in the coinâ€™s value and price. Later, he went on to announce that Tesla would accept the meme coin as payment. This further increased Dogecoinâ€™s usability and expanded its community.
Within one year, from 2021 to 2022, this coin saw an over 2,900% jump in its value. As of now, it has a staggering market cap of around $14 billion.
Avalanche

Built with three individual blockchains, Avalanche is capable of carrying out transactions at a much faster rate. It is highly scalable and can perform 6,500 transactions every second and is one of the fastest smart contract platforms. This has contributed to its popularity.
Avalanche is a relatively new cryptocurrency launched in 2020. But right now, it has a market cap of over $4 billion. Starting at the $4 level in 2020, this coin is now trading at the $18 range.
Takeaway

Although cryptocurrencies are risky assets, they can help churn out better profit when compared to traditional investment options. title: What Is an Initial Coin Offering (ICO)?

children.text: The Initial Coin Offering (ICO) is a kind of capital-raising approach in the world of cryptocurrency and blockchain. Although, it works equivalent to an organisationâ€™s Initial Public Offering (IPO), however, the key difference between IPO and ICO is that the latter uses cryptocurrency and is transacted digitally.

However, this is not only the exact comparison since several differences are there among these two fundraising activities. When it comes to an ICO, investors earn cryptocurrency by exchanging their funds. To get a deeper insight into this topic, keep reading.
What Do You Mean by Initial Coin Offering (ICO)?

The Initial Currency Offering or Initial Coin Offering (ICO) is a method of funding that uses crypto. In general, it is a form of crowdfunding that does not look for public investment. In case of an ICO, an amount of cryptocurrency is sold as â€˜tokensâ€™ or â€˜coinsâ€™ to investors or speculators in the exchange for various other cryptocurrencies like Ethereum or Bitcoin.

Newly established organisations that deal with crypto utilise an ICO in order to collect funds from potential investors. This approach of raising funds provides double benefits to the organisation alongside assisting them to raise the preliminary funds as well as enabling them to form a user base based on their product. Thus, ICO provides a utility value to its buyers and inspires them to take part in the ecosystem of the company.
Investors taking part in ICO may either sell their crypto online or convert it into fiat currency. Since this ICO market is volatile, it can become risky for the investors taking part in them.
What Are the Types of Initial Coin Offerings?
Mentioned below are two main types of ICO which are dominant in the crypto market:
Private ICO

Only some selected investors can avail the private initial coin offering. In general, this kind of approach is limited to rich institutional investors and high-net-worth persons. This activity produces a substantial amount of capital which boons top marketing opportunities for the organisation.
Public ICO

Another type of Initial Coin Offering (ICO) is the Public ICO. In this kind of fundraising approach, organisations provide their tokens to the public as well as retail investors. This is why it is an independent method of crowdfunding that emphasises on increasing the user base of tokens successfully.

Owing to its proper regulations, private ICOs are considered even more worthwhile investments than public offerings. Typically, the company determines the entire amount they are willing to produce from a private ICO through various presentations, meetings, and conferences. In 2018, the Telegram messaging application unveiled a private ICO which turned the tide and raised beyond $1.7 Billion from experienced investors.
What Are the Merits of ICO?
The benefits of an Initial Coin Offering (ICO) are discussed below:
Due to minimal rules and regulations, these are much more effective and easy ways of raising funds for companies.
Maximum ICOs are open to any individual, organisation or cooperative. This is why an ICO has a comprehensive platform and is more accessible than various other investment options such as IPO.
Participating in an ICO provides you with an initial benefit by which you can have a chance to buy these coins at less price and trade them in sound crypto exchanges once their value escalates.

Making an investment in ICOcan be highlyprofitable. So, if you go for the correct ICO that focuses on the market in-depth and stay invested it in the long-term, you can expect getting considerable returns.
What Are the Demerits of ICO?
Apart from advantages, there are several disadvantages of participating in ICO as stated below:
Investors do not possess any previous record about these crypto coins. This is why you need to gather in-depth knowledge regarding the condition of crypto markets in order to get success.

Cryptocurrencies do not possess any backing of an asset. This makes them volatile and feature high risk. There are manifold instances of start-ups where the value got eroded down the line and investors suffered huge losses.

Since these offerings are not controlled by a governing body, it has become an arena for plenty of fraudulent activities. Here tricksters often flee with your money from which you cannot expect any return.
How Do ICOs Work?

In fact, the unique venture capital raising concept of ICO has become a popular way ahead for new-generation start-up companies by adopting the decentralised mechanism of blockchain technology. The companies issue and distribute tokens which are traded via cryptocurrency exchanges and can serve different functions, from allowing investors access to different services to providing them with company dividends.
Defining Investment Objective

At first, the company defines the objective of fundraising, the target audience, and required amount of fund. This helps them in preparing the required documents like a prospectus to let prospective investors know about the background of the company, project, and scope of earning.
Generation of Tokens

ICO tokens symbolise a part of an asset or value. The tokens are mutually interchangeable and tradeable on crypto exchanges. Instead of providing any stake in the company as general stocks or shares do, most tokens are generated to provide a share of the products or services of the company.

Generating tokens does not need the particular company to create codes from the beginning which is applicable while generating cryptocurrencies. Rather, the company utilises the existing cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin or Ethereum that are already accessible and popular in the blockchain landscape.
Promotional Campaigning

Thereafter, the company initiates its promotion campaigning in order to draw potential investors. Typically, such campaigns are performed online to reach the largest number of investors. They are not legally allowed to promote on popular social platforms.
Initial Offering

Once the tokens are generated and the promotional campaign is over, the company starts its initial offering to raise its required capital in a formula of multiple rounds. The company uses its pooled funds to introduce the product or services. On the other hand, investors need to wait for the value appreciation of the tokens and by trading them across cryptocurrency exchanges.
Steps to Buy Tokens from Initial Coin Offering (ICO)
An individual can easily purchase coins in ICO by following the steps as stated below:
Step 1
: Visit the platform which is providing the initial coin offering.
Step
: Enter your credentials and carry out the registration successfully.
Step 3
: Transfer the necessary fiat or digital currency to the respective platform.
Step 4
: Choose the exact number of tokens you are planning to purchase.
Step 5
: Click on the 'Place Your Orderâ€™ option to complete your purchase.
Upon completion of all these steps successfully, the shares will be conveyed to your respective crypto wallets.
Takeaway

In a nutshell, an Initial coin offering (ICO) enables start-up businesses to influence the escalating popularity of cryptocurrencies among investors and pool venture capital through digital platforms. Similarly, as a potential investor, you can earn profits by trading your acquired tokens at the beginning and selling them once their price enhances. However, before investing, make sure to research diligently about the organisation to evaluate its authenticity and prospect.

title: A Detailed Overview of Bitcoinâ€™s Price History (2009- 2022)

children.text: Since its inception, Bitcoin has been the largest cryptocurrency in the world. Founded in 2008 by a group or person under the pseudonym of Satoshi Nakamoto, this crypto coin still has a massive market cap of over $444 billion.

Interestingly, during its early days back in 2009, this obscure crypto had a price of a fraction of a penny. However, since then BTC has come a long way and touched its all-time high of $67,617 in 2022! It is one of the hottest crypto assets to own right now.
But as a highly volatile asset, BTC has also witnessed major fluctuations in its price. Letâ€™s check out a detailed rundown on the ups and downs of Bitcoin price till now since the beginning.
Price History with Reference to Bitcoinâ€™s Growth Stages
Although Bitcoin is now probably the best and the most coveted crypto to invest in, it had a very humble and slow beginning. Initially, when launched back in 2009, Bitcoin had no value at all.

However, its value started to rise as transactions began and its adoption saw a rise. This crypto had to experience massive ups and down that impacted its coin price significantly. Letâ€™s find out Bitcoinâ€™s price history in different stages of its growth.
The Formative Years (2009-2012)

2009 to 2012 were the formative early years of Bitcoin. There werenâ€™t many transactions or buying of this cryptocurrency during its early years. BTC got its monetary value first in 2009 when a Finnish student sold 5050 coins at around â‚¹414. This gave each Bitcoin a value of only $0.0009!

However, as per crypto analysts who have been closely following Bitcoin, the original real-life transaction was first carried out in 2010 by a Florida resident. Laszlo Hanyecz purchased two pizzas in exchange for 10,000 BTC! Back then, it was worth around â‚¹3,380. That means each BTC was priced at a meagre $0.0041.
Finally, in June 2011, BTC touched $1 for the first time. This was a crucial moment for this cryptocurrency.
The Phase of Upward Trajectory (2013-2017)

The price of Bitcoin has been witnessing a consistent rise since 2013. Bitcoin saw a rise in its adoption and transactions shot up. That helped Bitcoin increase its price per coin. Also, this was the phase when BTC started gaining traction worldwide with many interested in investing in cryptocurrency.

In November 2013, BTC touched and crossed the $1,000 mark. However, 2014 had been a struggling year for the crypto as it began to fall due to the collapse of Mt. Gox, which handled 70% of BTC transactions. By early 2015, BTC suffered a massive drop to the $170 level.

In 2015 and 2016, Bitcoin began to recover slowly and steadily as it began to get more and more investors. By the following year, Bitcoin began to get more and more media coverage which helped it bag more investors.

It was in 2017 that the crypto coin managed to touch as well as cross the $10,000 level. By the end of 2017, BTC moved upwards further to reach $17,000. In Indian currency, the price of Bitcoin stood at over â‚¹3,29,000 in August 2017.
Phase of Recovery and All-time-high (2018-2021

In 2018, Bitcoin didnâ€™t see much activity. The price, however, moved to a decent $3,000 level towards the end of the year. 2019 to 2021 was a remarkable period for the crypto coin. More and more mainstream media began to cover BTC and its price movement. Many began to consider it a scam while some called it one of the greatest assets to invest in.

In 2020, BTC wasnâ€™t spared by the impact of the pandemic on global economy. It lost around 50% of its value within 2 days. But on the positive side, with the pandemic raging the world, more and more people were keen on investing in cryptocurrency. The crypto frenzy reached the highest level. By the middle of the year, BTC rallied to as high as $9,100.

Now, comes 2021, which has been the most significant year for Bitcoin. In 2021, this cryptocurrency touched its all-time high of $67,617. Thatâ€™s not all! This crypto witnessed a push in its adoption, with El Salvador becoming the first currency in the world to accept BTC as its legal tender.
Crypto Winter (2022)

The global economy began to falter further towards the end of 2021 as inflation started to soar and fear of recession crept in. Banks and other centralised agencies began to increase the interest rate as a corrective measure. This impacted the overall crypto space and BTC was obviously no exception. The entire year saw a consistent slump in coin prices with many analysts terming this phase as Crypto Winter.
Bitcoinâ€™s price fell below the $20,000 level during the Crypto Winter. As of early 2023, Bitcoin made a slight recovery and is trading at around $23,000 a coin.
Takeaway

Bitcoin underwent various ups and down in its span of over 10 years of existence. There are various crucial factors that impacted the price of cryptocurrencies including Bitcoin. Some of these factors included supply of money, overall market sentiment, supply and demand factors and more.

Considering the speculative nature of crypto coins, the coin prices are bound to rise or fall depending on various factors. Bitcoin is the largest crypto right now and as per experts, it is set to hold its position in the future as well.

title: How to develop the right trading psychology to become a successful crypto trader?

children.text:
Cryptocurrency trading may be a marathon, not a sprint. It requires both mental and physical stamina. To be a successful crypto trader, you would like to have the right mindset.
Here are some tips to develop the proper trading psychology:
Have realistic expectations

The cryptocurrency market is very volatile and unpredictable, so it's important to have realistic expectations when trading. Expect the worth of your portfolio to go up and down. Donâ€™t get too attached to your gains or too discouraged by your losses. it's important to remember that you can make a profit in both rising and falling markets, so aren't getting discouraged if your trades don't always go your way. Don't let your emotions dictate your trading decisions. it's also important to remember that there is no guaranteed way to make money in the market, so don't invest quite you can afford to lose. Always do your research and never risk quite what you are comfortable with. this is often because you could end up losing all of your investment if the market turns against you. Finally, it's also important to remember that you need to have a solid plan and strategy before starting trading. this may help you to minimize your risks and maximize your chances of making a profit.
Be patient

It takes time, patience, and discipline to achieve success. it's essential to be patient when developing a crypto trading strategy. Many factors have to be considered when constructing a strategy. the method of developing a strategy can take time, but it's essential to be patient and methodical in your approach. It is also important to remember that no one knows everything about the market and that there is always room for improvement in your strategy. twiddling my thumbs in your learning process and always be willing to revise your strategy as new information arises. To develop a crypto trading strategy, you'll need to have a good understanding of the market and the assets you are trading. it's important to be familiar with technical analysis and charting techniques in order to make informed investment decisions. These tools will facilitate your identifying trends and patterns in the market that can be used to your advantage. Once you've got a good understanding of the market and the assets you are trading, you'll begin to develop a trading strategy. you'll take many different approaches, but it's important to find one that fits your personality and risk tolerance. it's also important to test your strategy on a demo account before implementing it with real money. this may allow you to see how your strategy performs in live market conditions. When you are ready to implement your strategy, it's important to do so with a well-known and reputable broker. it's also important to make sure that the broker you choose offers a good trading platform. Once you've got chosen a broker and a platform, you'll begin to trade. make certain to set realistic goals and be patient in your approach. Remember that the market is very volatile and that you may experience losses along the way. However, if you stick with your strategy and remain patient, you'll eventually be rewarded with profits.
Be disciplined

To develop a disciplined approach to trading cryptocurrencies, it's important to have a clear understanding of what your goals are and what you are willing to risk to achieve them. Without this understanding, it's easy to get caught up in the excitement of the market and make impulsive decisions that can lead to losses. Having a solid plan for a way you will trade is also important. This plan should include what you will buy and sell, also as how you will manage your risk.
